oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reactions of Di-o-tolyl Telluride and Selenide with Palladium Acetate: Isolation of a Novel Palladium Complex of a Tellurenic Acid Anhydride and Related Trinuclear and Tetranuclear Palladium Complexes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHAKRABORTY, T
SHARMA, S
SINGH, HB
BUTCHER, RJ
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: SULFUR-CONTAINING PALLADACYCLES
X-RAY STRUCTURES
HECK REACTION
CATALYST PRECURSORS
COUPLING REACTIONS
METAL-COMPLEXES
CHEMISTRY
LIGANDS
PD(II)
CYCLOMETALATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The reaction of di-o-tolyl telluride with palladium acetate provided a novel palladium complex of a tellurenic acid anhydride, (o-tolyl-Te)(2)OPdOAc(2), and a linear trinuclear complex, [Pd(o-tolyl){di-o-tolyl telluride}](2)Pd(mu-OAc)(2). The reaction of di-o-tolyl selenide with palladium acetate affoxded a tetranuclear complex of rare geometry, [Pd(OAc)(mu-Se-o-tolyl)](4).
